sources.data_found: 2022 Awarded Degrees for 'Computer & Information Sciences': 172 Bachelor's, 421 Master's, 19 Doctoral.

student_data.notes: Exact current enrollment by major is not published on the open web by GWU SEAS. Counts are estimated using DataUSA/IPEDS 'degrees awarded' (2022) and program duration multipliers. Undergrad: 172 degrees * 4 years = 688. Grad (MS): 421 degrees * 2 years = 842. PhD: 19 degrees * 5.5 years = ~105. These estimates fit within the verified SEAS totals (1,023 Undergrad, 1,733 Grad) found on the engineering.gwu.edu Facts page.

gpu_resources.notes: Pegasus Cluster is the primary shared resource. Documentation confirms 16 GPU nodes (Dell C4140), each equipped with 2x NVIDIA V100 GPUs. Total = 16 * 2 = 32 V100s. No public mention of H100/A100 nodes in the general access partitions (defq/gpuq). [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: GWU's primary HPC resource is 'Pegasus'. While older documentation mentions 'Colonial One' (which had K20/K80s), it is decommissioned. Newer procurement documents or grants regarding A100/H100 clusters were searched but no public general-access cluster specifications were found beyond the V100 nodes on Pegasus.
